translation: Guangfan daishi give it to the purple-colored ascetic minister Weijing

source_sentence: 「爾時尊者大目乾連禮彼佛足，作是白言：『世尊！
translation: At the time, Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana bowed at their feet and said, 'Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我今悔罪！
translation: I now repent of my sins!

source_sentence: 我今悔罪！
translation: I now repent of my sins!

source_sentence: 我於釋迦牟尼如來無量音聲清淨妙輪輒欲度量，我斯深罪。
translation: My profound sin is that I want to measure the pure and marvelous wheel of the Tathāgata Śākyamuni's immeasurable voice.

source_sentence: 又復世尊！
translation: Again, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我所來此幾何遠邪？』
translation: How far is this where I come from?'

source_sentence: 彼佛答言：『大目乾連！
translation: The Buddha answered, 'O Mahāmaudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 汝過九十九殑伽沙數等世界已，到此剎中。』
translation: After you pass through ninety-nine sands of worlds and so forth, you'll reach this buddha.'

source_sentence: 大目乾連白言：『我此所來而極遙遠，身力疲懈，不能還復本剎土中。』
translation: Mahāmaudgalyāyana said, 'I came here from a great distance, and my body is so weary that I can't return to my original buddha land.'

source_sentence: 彼佛告言：『大目乾連！
translation: The Buddha told him, 'O Mahāmaudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 於汝意云何？
translation: What do you think?

source_sentence: 汝勿起是見，謂汝以自神力能到此剎。
translation: Don't give rise to this view, saying that you can reach this buddha with your own supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 但以釋迦牟尼如來加持力故，汝能至此。
translation: It's only because of the empowering power of the Śākyamuni Tathāgata that you can reach this place.

source_sentence: 汝今欲還本剎土者，應向彼佛虔伸敬禮。
translation: If you now want to return to your original buddha land, you should venerate and pay homage to that Buddha.

source_sentence: 大目乾連！
translation: Mahāmaudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 汝今當知，若以汝自通力欲還本土，縱經一劫亦不能往，或復未至彼土中間而入涅槃。
translation: You should now know that if you want to return to your native land with your own supernormal powers, even for an eon you won't be able to do so, or maybe you won't enter nirvāṇa in the middle of that land.

source_sentence: 大目乾連！
translation: Mahāmaudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 汝今至此，東西南北謂何方分邪？』
translation: Now, when you come here, where do you say east, west, south, and north are the parts that are wrong?'

source_sentence: 大目乾連言：『我心迷昧，不知今時在何方分。』
translation: Mahāmaudgalyāyana said, 'My mind is so deluded that I don't know where to part with it at the present time.'

source_sentence: 彼佛告言：『以是緣故，汝今當知，若以汝自通力，縱經一劫，畢竟不能還彼剎土。』
translation: The Buddha told them, 'It's because of these reasons that you should now know that if you use your own supernormal powers for even an eon, you won't be able to return to that buddha land after all.'

source_sentence: 大目乾連言：『彼世尊釋迦牟尼如來今在何方？』
translation: Mahāmaudgalyāyana said, 'Where is the Bhagavān, Śākyamuni Tathāgata, where are you now?'

source_sentence: 彼佛告言：『大目乾連！
translation: The Buddha told him, 'O Mahāmaudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 彼世尊釋迦牟尼如來現處東方。』
translation: That Bhagavān, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni Tathāgata, is present in the east.'

source_sentence: 「『二足聖尊攝受我，　　人天供養大威德，
translation: 'The two-legged sage honored one takes in me, and humans and gods make offerings of great authority.

source_sentence: 無邊智具無邊音，　　我今欲還於本土。』
translation: Boundless wisdom has limitless sound, and now I want to return to my native land.'

source_sentence: 是時尊者大目乾連即向東方五輪著地，至誠敬禮世尊釋迦牟尼如來，說伽陀曰：「寂慧！
translation: Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana then faced the east, set his five wheels on the ground, paid sincere homage to the Bhagavān Śākyamuni Tathāgata, and said to Gadha, Silent Wisdom!

source_sentence: 今此王舍城鷲峯山中一切眾會，以釋迦牟尼如來威神力故，悉聞尊者大目乾連號哭之聲。」
translation: Now, all the assembled people in this city of Rājagṛha on Vulture Peak heard the weeping sound of Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana wailing because of the Tathāgata Śākyamuni's authoritative power.

source_sentence: 爾時尊者阿難前白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that Venerable Ānanda went to the Buddha and said, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 今此所聞號哭之聲，為何相邪？」
translation: What's wrong with the sound of wailing and weeping that you've heard now?

source_sentence: 佛言阿難：「此是目乾連苾芻往西方分，去此佛剎過九十九殑伽沙數等剎土，
translation: The Buddha said to Ānanda: This is the part where the monk Moggallāna proceeded toward the West. Departing from this buddha-stage, he passed through as many buddha-lands as there are sands in ninety-nine Ganges rivers.

source_sentence: 到光明幢世界世尊光明王如來剎中，現在於彼將欲還復此娑婆界故，有如是號哭之聲。」
translation: He went to the buddha of the Bhagavān, the Tathāgata King of Light in the world of the Banner of Light, and now there's this sound of wailing and weeping because he's about to return to this sahā realm.

source_sentence: 阿難白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Ānanda said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 尊者大目乾連以何緣故到彼世界？」
translation: What is the reason Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana came to that world?

source_sentence: 佛言：「阿難！
translation: The Buddha said, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 大目乾連將還此土，其事因緣汝自當知。」
translation: Mahāmaudgalyāyana is about to return to this land, and you should know for yourself the causes and conditions for that matter.

source_sentence: 爾時鷲峯山中一切眾會，合掌恭敬咸白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that all the assembled people on Vulture Peak Mountain joined their palms and respectfully said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我等樂見彼光明幢世界，瞻覩世尊光明王如來，及欲見彼諸菩薩眾并尊者大目乾連。」
translation: We're delighted to see that world of the banner of light, and we're gazing at the Bhagavān, the Tathāgata King of Light, as well as those bodhisattvas and Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana who want to see them.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊受勸請已，即於眉間放大光明，名一切處通達，其光普照九十九殑伽沙數等佛剎相續不斷，
translation: At that moment the World-Honored One, having been encouraged and invited, emanated a ray of light from between his eyebrows called omniscience. That light illuminated as many buddha-lands as there are grains of sand in ninety-nine Ganges Rivers, one after another, without ceasing.

source_sentence: 於彼光明幢世界廣大照曜。
translation: In that world of the banner of light, there's a vast shining radiance.

source_sentence: 是時此會一切大眾，悉得見彼光明幢世界，瞻覩世尊光明王如來，及見彼諸菩薩，
translation: At that time all the great assemblies in this assembly saw the world Banner of Light, and gazed at the World-honored One, King of Light, as well as those enlightening beings.

source_sentence: 又見大目乾連五輪著地，向佛作禮發聲號哭。
translation: Again, he saw Mahāmaudgalyāyana with his five wheels touching the ground bowed to the Buddha and cried out in tears.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊釋迦牟尼如來告尊者大目乾連言：「汝今宜應隨光所照，來復此土。」
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān Śākyamuni Tathāgata addressed Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana, saying, Now, you should follow the light and come back to this land.

source_sentence: 爾時尊者大目乾連承佛世尊大光明輪，於思念間即時還此娑婆世界，住立佛前，
translation: At that time the venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana, having received from the Buddha the great wheel of light of the World-honored One, immediately returned to this sahā world and remained standing in front of the Buddha.

source_sentence: 向佛世尊頭面禮足，右繞七匝，重復諦誠五輪著地，作是白言：「世尊！
translation: He bowed his head and feet at the Buddha Bhagavān's feet, circled him seven times to his right, again placed his five sincere wheels on the ground, and said, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我今悔罪！
translation: I now repent of my sins!

source_sentence: 我今悔罪！
translation: I now repent of my sins!

source_sentence: 我於世尊無量音聲清淨妙輪輒欲度量，我斯深罪故。
translation: I simply want to measure the pure and marvelous wheel of the Bhagavān's immeasurable sound, because this is a profound sin for me.

source_sentence: 我遠適他界聽佛音聲，既至彼已，所聞佛聲與此無異。」
translation: From afar, I'll go to another realm and hear the sound of the Buddha's voice, and when I reach that place, the sound of the Buddha's voice won't be different from this one.

source_sentence: 佛言：「目乾連！
translation: The Buddha said, Maudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 如汝所說。
translation: It's as you say.

source_sentence: 如來音聲無有分量，猶如虛空無其分量，復無邊際不可度量。
translation: The Tathāgata's voice has no measure, just as space has no measure, and there are no limits that can be measured.

source_sentence: 若其虛空可度量者，如來音聲亦可度量。
translation: If space can be measured, the Tathāgata's voice can also be measured.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 虛空廣大故，如來音聲亦復廣大。」
translation: Because space is vast, the Tathāgata's voice is also vast.

source_sentence: 當王舍城中往昔說是大目乾連去來事時，有十千人發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心。
translation: In the past, 10,000 people in Rājagṛha said this was Mahāmaudgalyāyana's deed of going and coming, and 10,000 people aroused the mind of unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment.

source_sentence: 金剛手菩薩告寂慧菩薩言：「寂慧當知，此即是為如來語密。
translation: The Vajrapāṇi Bodhisattva addressed the bodhisattva Silent Wisdom, saying, Silent Wisdom, you should know that this is the secret of the Tathāgata's words.

source_sentence: 「復次寂慧！
translation: Furthermore, Silent Wisdom!

source_sentence: 六十四者，所有一切眾生心心所轉，而一眾生心多於彼。」
translation: The sixty-fourth is that all sentient beings' minds and mental factors are transformed by the minds of all sentient beings, but one sentient being's mind is more numerous than theirs.

source_sentence: 寂慧菩薩言：「大祕密主！
translation: The bodhisattva of silent wisdom said, Great esoteric lord!

source_sentence: 若一眾生心心所轉，假使遍滿三千大千世界一切眾生皆居緣覺之地，縱經一劫而亦不能思惟稱量校計伺察，
translation: If a single sentient being's mind and mental factors evolve, even if they pervade 3,000 great one-thousand worlds, all sentient beings who live in the land of pratyekabuddha would be unable to contemplate, measure, evaluate, or examine them even for an eon.

source_sentence: 何況一切眾生？」
translation: How could it be possible for all sentient beings?

source_sentence: 金剛手菩薩言：「寂慧！
translation: The Vajrapāṇi Bodhisattva said, Silent wisdom!

source_sentence: 我今告語於汝，使汝開覺所有一切眾生心心所轉，即彼如來音聲妙輪出種種聲宣說法時，
translation: I now tell you this, enabling you to awaken the minds and mental states of all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 令諸眾生咸生歡喜，然佛世尊常住無分別捨。」
translation: It causes all sentient beings to become joyous, yet the Bhagavān always abides without discriminating and abandoning.

source_sentence: 「三千世界諸眾生，　　一切皆證緣覺果，
translation: The sentient beings of the 3,000 worlds All realize the fruit of enlightenment.

source_sentence: 縱經一劫盡籌量，　　一眾生心不能曉。
translation: Even if one eon were to pass and be counted, One sentient being could not understand it at all.

source_sentence: 世間所有一眾生，　　唯佛能知彼心意，
translation: All sentient beings in the world Can only be known by Buddha:

source_sentence: 隨眾生心雖了知，　　佛無發悟無分別。
translation: Although they are known according to the minds of sentient beings, Buddha has no enlightenment and no discrimination.

source_sentence: 乃至一切眾生類，　　總聚思惟有其三，
translation: There are three general categories of contemplation Of all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 世尊隨類如所應，　　淨妙聲輪宣正法。
translation: Bhagavān, according to their type, explains the right teaching in the pure and wonderful sound wheel as it should be.

source_sentence: 法中自在演妙音，　　一切聞者咸欣悅，
translation: In the midst of the Teaching they freely utter wondrous sounds, Delighted by all who hear.

source_sentence: 隨所宣說名相生，　　以諸法名善開示。
translation: According to the names and characteristics of what they proclaim, they are produced by naming things as well as revealing them.

source_sentence: 所有一切眾生類，　　色相名字及思惟，
translation: All the types of sentient beings there are, Their forms, signs, names and thoughts:

source_sentence: 一毛孔中放光明，　　如來隨應善分別。
translation: A ray of light emanates from a single pore; The enlightened one distinguishes well according to what’s appropriate.

source_sentence: 所有世尊大慈化，　　一切毛孔放光明，
translation: The great compassionate emanations of all the Buddhas, All their pores emitting light.

source_sentence: 光明超勝人中尊，　　音聲輪中宣妙法。
translation: The light is supremely superior, honored among men; In the sphere of sound it proclaims the sublime Teaching.

source_sentence: 假使佛經一劫中，　　以諸譬喻善宣說，
translation: Suppose the Buddha were to teach in a single eon By means of metaphors and illustrations.

source_sentence: 然佛語及音聲輪，　　畢竟不得其邊際。
translation: Still, the Buddha's words and sound-wheel of sounds ultimately don't reach their limit.

source_sentence: 一切煩惱無色相，　　所說語言亦無相，
translation: All afflictions have formless characteristics, And the verbal expressions spoken of are also formless.

source_sentence: 由其語言無相因，　　煩惱無相自息滅。
translation: As a result of the signlessness of their words, the afflictions cease on their own.

source_sentence: 是故語言諸色相，　　於一切處不可得，
translation: Therefore, the forms and characteristics of language Are ungraspable in all places.

source_sentence: 以其畢竟無得故，　　煩惱色相亦如是。
translation: Because they are ultimately ungraspable, So are the forms and characteristics of affliction.

source_sentence: 由其語言不實故，　　所說非內亦非外，
translation: Because their words are insubstantial, What they teach is neither internal nor external.

source_sentence: 煩惱不實亦復然，　　染性非內亦非外。
translation: The same applies to defilement that is not real: Defiled by nature, it neither is internal nor external.

source_sentence: 以無少法可得故，　　佛所說言遍十方，
translation: Because there is no little thing to be found, The Buddha’s teaching pervades the ten directions.

source_sentence: 煩惱無得亦復然，　　是故有所佛宣說。
translation: So it is with the absence of afflictions and their attainments; therefore, there's something that the Buddha teaches.

source_sentence: 一切眾生語言道，　　上中下品有其三，
translation: The path of all sentient beings is the path of speech. There are three higher, middle, and lower classes.

source_sentence: 語言非身亦非心，　　此中無住非無住。
translation: What's spoken of is not body and what's not mind, and here there's neither abiding nor nonabiding.

source_sentence: 譬如假法成樂具，　　由風吹擊眾音聲，
translation: It is as if the wind were to blow and smash all sounds, And make them into instruments of music By means of a magic trick.

source_sentence: 所出音聲無所從，　　是中亦無造作者。
translation: The sound that comes forth has no source, and there's no author here, either.

source_sentence: 由其宿昔善淨性，　　一切眾生意風吹，
translation: Because of their past goodness and purity, All sentient beings are blown by the wind of business.

source_sentence: 故佛世尊出妙音，　　然佛亦無分別想。
translation: That's why the Buddha Bhagavān produces a marvelous sound, but the Buddha also has no discriminating thoughts.

source_sentence: 譬如應聲而對響，　　音響非內亦非外，
translation: It’s like responding to an echo and reversing it, A sound that is neither internal nor external.

source_sentence: 人中尊出妙言語，　　非內非外亦如是。
translation: Among humans, the honored one utters subtle words, neither inside nor outside, as well.

source_sentence: 又如珠寶無分別，　　令諸眾生喜樂生，
translation: Like a jewel that has no discrimination, Causing sentient beings to give rise to joy and happiness.

source_sentence: 佛無分別亦復然，　　一切音聲皆圓滿。
translation: The Buddha has no discrimination, and so it is with all sounds: All sounds are complete.

source_sentence: 爾時金剛手菩薩說伽陀曰：「復次寂慧！
translation: It was then that the Vajrapāṇi Bodhisattva spoke to Gadha, saying, Furthermore, Jīvaka!

source_sentence: 當知如來語祕密智，隨入一切眾生宣說諸法。
translation: You should know that the esoteric knowledge of the Tathāgata's words follows all sentient beings and explains the teachings accordingly.

source_sentence: 所有三千大千世界一切眾生種種生處，如來隨入一切眾生語言音聲，以種種名字安立四諦。
translation: In all the various birth places of all sentient beings in the 3,000 great one-thousand worlds, the Tathāgata follows the speech and sounds of all sentient beings into the four noble truths by naming them by various names.

source_sentence: 寂慧！
translation: Silent wisdom!

source_sentence: 如其所說，苦、苦集、苦滅、向苦滅道諦。
translation: As has been said: “Suffering, frustration, the origin of frustration, frustration and the cessation of frustration®”*°; the truth of the path leading to frustration and to the one of cessation of frustration.

source_sentence: 「所有地居諸天作如是說：「『珂吠　珂嚩牟梨　珂嚩那曳　珂嚩度嚕「『即是此說苦、苦集、苦滅、向苦滅道諦。』
translation: All the gods who live in the earth say, 'This is the teaching of the truth of suffering, the arising of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the path leading to the cessation of suffering.'

source_sentence: 「彼空居諸天作如是說：「『多哩帝　阿嚩哩帝　阿嚩哩多尾誐彌　阿嚩哩多儞薩多囉尼「『即是此說苦、苦集、苦滅、向苦滅道諦。』
translation: The gods of the sky-dwelling heavens say, 'Tāritī, Ārya, Ānanda, Ānanda, Kauṇḍinya, Kātyāyana, and Apariṭṭṭha explain this as follows: 'This is the teaching of the truth of suffering, the arising of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the path leading to the cessation of

source_sentence: 「彼四大王天作如是說：「『伊尼　彌尼　捺紕　捺羅紕「『即是此說苦、苦集、苦滅、向苦滅道諦。』
translation: The four great kings of the gods of the four great elements make this statement, saying, 'These are the teachings of suffering, the arising of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the path leading to the cessation of suffering.'

source_sentence: 「彼忉利天作如是說：「『阿嚩哩多儞　阿西嚩帝　叉野嚩帝　叉野耨誐彌「『即是此說苦、苦集、苦滅、向苦滅道諦。』
translation: The Trāyastriṃśa gods made this statement, saying, 'Ātṛtapāda, Asitaṇī, Kauṇḍinya, Kauṇḍinya, and Kauṇḍinya say, 'This is the teaching of the truth of suffering, the arising of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the path leading to the cessation of suffering.'

source_sentence: 「彼夜摩天作如是說：「『輸梨　輸羅西嚩儞　輸羅叉曳　輸羅叉野婆嚩儞「『即是此說苦苦集苦滅向苦滅道諦。』
translation: The Yama gods say, 'Śāriputra, Śāriputra, Śāriputra, Śāriputra, Śāriputra, Śāriputra, Śāriputra, Śāriputra, Śāriputra, Śāriputra, Śāriputra, Śāriputra, Śāriputra, Śāriputra, Śāriputra, Śāriputra,

source_sentence: 「彼兜率天作如是說：「『烏珂梨　目珂梨　尾嚩努　散左哩「『即是此說苦、苦集、苦滅、向苦滅道諦。』
translation: The Tuṣita gods thus say, 'Eunuch, Maudgalyāyana, Kauṇḍinya, Vaiśravaṇa, and Sañjali explain that this is the teaching of suffering, the arising of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the path leading to the cessation of suffering.'

source_sentence: 「彼化樂天作如是說：「『多囉多　散多囉多　多囉叉野　多囉目珂「『即是此說苦、苦集、苦滅、向苦滅道諦。』
translation: The Nirmāṇarati gods thus say, 'Tārata, Suffering, the arising of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the path leading to the cessation of suffering.'

source_sentence: 「彼他化自在天作如是說：「『訶訶呼　訶訶尾那曳　訶訶尾誐彌　訶囉儞誐彌「『即是此說苦、苦集、苦滅、向苦滅道諦。』

source_sentence: 如是等諸天，各各以其隨天語言安立四諦，并餘龍眾、夜叉眾、乾闥婆眾、阿修羅眾、迦樓羅眾、緊那羅眾、摩睺羅伽眾，
translation: Each of these gods established the four truths by following the language of the gods, along with the other dragons, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kiṃnaras, and mahoragas.

source_sentence: 及堅身夜叉眾、持鬘夜叉眾等，各以彼彼種類語言安立四諦。
translation: Each of the four noble truths are established by means of various kinds of words, such as those of the firm-body yakṣas and the yakṣas who hold swords or spears.

source_sentence: 「寂慧！
translation: Silent wisdom!

source_sentence: 此閻浮提諸國土中，少略而言滿千國土，乃至十六大國一切人眾，隨彼方處種種語言、種種音聲、種種心想，
translation: In all these continents of Jambudvfpa there are, in sum, a thousand continents. All the people living in those continents speak various languages, sounds, and concepts according to their locations.

source_sentence: 如來隨入一切語言音聲施設名字，所立四諦悉能解了。
translation: The Tathāgata follows the names established by entering into all languages and sounds, and he's able to understand the four truths established.

source_sentence: 所謂尸迦國人，乃至世界邊際所住國人，如是等閻浮提中滿千國土，一切人眾種種語言、種種音聲、種種心想，
translation: The so-called people of Śīlabhadra and even the nations where they live at the borders of the worlds fill a thousand lands in Jambudvipa like this, with various languages, sounds, and thoughts of all kinds of people.

source_sentence: 施設名字各說四諦。
translation: Each designation of names teaches the four truths.

source_sentence: 如來隨入一切語言音聲悉能解了，亦非如來心識語言有所流散。
translation: The Tathāgata can understand all the sounds and sounds of all languages as they enter, and it's not that the Tathāgata's mind and consciousnesses and words have dispersed.

source_sentence: 寂慧！

source_sentence: 此小千世界中有九十四俱胝那庾多百千種類語言名字，各說四諦，總攝一切所說言音，
translation: In this small chiliocosm, there are ninety-four quadrillions of hundreds of thousands of different names and expressions, each saying the four truths, encompassing all the spoken words and sounds.

source_sentence: 皆悉同歸一四諦義，即是勝義諦、即是無生諦、即是如實諦、即是不動諦。
translation: They all return to the same meaning of one of the four truths, which are the ultimate truth, the truth of nonarising, the truth of thusness, and the immutable truth.

source_sentence: 寂慧！

source_sentence: 此即是為如來語密。

source_sentence: 「復次寂慧！

source_sentence: 如來語言而能斷除一切眾生疑惑不決，所謂十方無量阿僧祇世界普攝一切眾生，
translation: The Buddha’s words were able to remove the doubts and uncertainties of all sentient beings: so-called are the infinite, incalculable worlds in the ten directions taking care of all living beings.

source_sentence: 以佛智所知，而眾生界多於地界。
translation: Because it's known by the Buddha's wisdom, the realm of sentient beings is more numerous than the earth realm.

source_sentence: 寂慧！
translation: Silent wisdom!

source_sentence: 正使一切眾生各各獲得智慧具足，與尊者舍利子等無有異，以是緣故，
translation: It precisely so that all sentient beings will each attain the excellence of knowledge and wisdom, no different from those of Venerable Sāriputta. Because of this condition,

source_sentence: 一切眾生各各皆以如舍利子所等智慧，以疑惑事於一劫中或過一劫，共相問難思惟稱量伺察，
translation: Each of all sentient beings, by means of the wisdom equal to that of Śāriputra, asked questions and pondered together inconceivably many questions about doubtful matters for an eon or more.

source_sentence: 而一眾生復勝於一。
translation: Yet one sentient being is superior to the other.

source_sentence: 是諸眾生以所疑事互思惟已，一時俱來請問世尊。
translation: After these sentient beings had reflected on each other's doubts, they all came together at once to ask the Bhagavān questions.

source_sentence: 時佛世尊於彈指間應問皆答。
translation: The Bhagavān then answered the questions that should be asked between his fingers.

source_sentence: 是故世尊隨了一眾生所起心念，普攝一切眾生，咸以一音悉為宣說斷諸疑網，
translation: That is why the World-honored One, according to the mentalities of each sentient being, embraced all sentient beings and expounded to them in a single voice how to cut off the web of doubt.

source_sentence: 令諸眾生得斷疑已咸生歡喜。
translation: It causes all sentient beings to attain freedom from doubt and become joyous.

source_sentence: 寂慧！
translation: Silent wisdom!

source_sentence: 此即是名如來語言普能斷除一切眾生疑惑不決，然非如來心及語言有所動轉，
translation: This is what I call “the power of the Buddha’s words to dispel the doubts and uncertainties of all living beings.” But they do not evolve in the mind or speech of a buddha.

source_sentence: 一切皆是如實所說。
translation: They are all explained as they really are.

source_sentence: 寂慧當知，如是等說，皆是如來祕密之語希有之語。
translation: You should know that these teachings are all esoteric words of the Tathāgata, rare words.

source_sentence: 此即名為語業清淨。」
translation: This is called the purity of verbal action.

translation: He then paid homage to the great esoteric lord of the Vajrapāṇi Bodhisattva and bowed his head in reverence, gave rise to the highest idea of faith, and all said, Great esoteric lord!

source_sentence: 我等今時快得善利，獲聞金剛手菩薩宣說如來語密不思議法門。
translation: At the present time we have quickly attained a good reward, having heard the Vajrapāṇi Bodhisattva expound the inconceivable dharma-gate of the Tathāgata’s words.

source_sentence: 若諸眾生聞此所說信解無疑，是諸眾生所得人身功不唐棄，即為如來所應化度，
translation: If sentient beings hear these teachings and believe and understand them without doubt, the merit of the human body attained by sentient beings will not be lost—that is to say, they will be liberated by the buddhas.
